org.apache.flex.compiler.mxml

Interface IMXMLTagData

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IMXMLUnitData, ISourceLocation
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MXMLTagData

    public interface IMXMLTagData
extends IMXMLUnitData
    Represents an open tag, a close tag, or an empty tag in MXML.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface org.apache.flex.compiler.common.ISourceLocation

        UNKNOWN

    • Method Summary

      Gets this compilable text inside this tag.
      PrefixMap getCompositePrefixMap()
      Gets the namespace mapping that apply to this tag, taking ancestor tags into account.

      Gets the first child open tag of this tag.

      Gets the first child unit inside this tag.

      Gets the source location of this tag's child units.

    • Method Detail

      • getParentTag

        IMXMLTagData getParentTag()
        Gets the tag that contains this tag.

        If the document is not balanced before this tag, this method returns null.

        Returns:
        An IMXMLTagData object.

      • isEmptyTag

        boolean isEmptyTag()
        Determines whether this tag is empty.
        Returns:
        true if it is.

      • isCloseTag

        boolean isCloseTag()
        Determines whether this tag is a close tag.
        Specified by:
        isCloseTag in interface IMXMLUnitData
        Returns:
        true if it is.

      • hasExplicitCloseTag

        boolean hasExplicitCloseTag()
        Determines whether this tag has an actual close tag, and was not closed as a post-process step of MXML repair.
        Returns:
        If we have an explicit close tag.

      • getName

        String getName()
        Gets the name of this tag as written, such as "s:width.over" .
        Returns:
        The complete tag name, including a possible prefix and state.

      • getPrefix

        String getPrefix()
        Gets the prefix of this tag.

        If the tag does not have a prefix, this method returns null.

        Returns:
        The prefix as a String, or null.

      • getPrefixMap

        PrefixMap getPrefixMap()
        Gets the namespace mappings specified on this tag.
        Returns:
        A prefix map.

      • getCompositePrefixMap

        PrefixMap getCompositePrefixMap()
        Gets the namespace mapping that apply to this tag, taking ancestor tags into account.
        Returns:
        A prefix map.

      • getURI

        String getURI()
        Gets the URI of this tag.

        If the tag does not have a prefix, this method returns null.

        Returns:
        The URI as a String, or null.

      • getShortName

        String getShortName()
        Gets the short name of this tag, not including the prefix or state.
        Returns:
        The short tag name as a String

      • getXMLName

        XMLName getXMLName()
        Gets the name of this tag as an XMLName.

        This takes into account the prefix but not the state.

        Returns:
        The tag name as an XMLName.

      • getStateName

        String getStateName()
        Gets the state name for this tag.
        Returns:
        The state name as a String

      • isOffsetInAttributeList

        boolean isOffsetInAttributeList(int offset)
        Determines whether the specified offset falls inside the attribute list of this tag.
        Parameters:
        offset - The offset to test.
        Returns:
        true if the offset falls inside this tag's attribute list.

      • getAttributeDatas

        IMXMLTagAttributeData[] getAttributeDatas()
        Gets all of the attributes in this tag.
        Returns:
        All of the attributes as a array of IMXMLTagAttributeData objects.

      • getTagAttributeData

        IMXMLTagAttributeData getTagAttributeData(String attributeName)
        Gets the attribute in this tag that has the specified name.
        Parameters:
        attributeName - The name of the attribute.
        Returns:
        The attribute, or null if no such attribute exists.

      • getRawAttributeValue

        String getRawAttributeValue(String attributeName)
        Gets the attribute value in this tag for the specified attribute name.

        This value does not include the quotes.

        Parameters:
        attributeName - The name of the attribute.
        Returns:
        The value of the attribute, or null if no such attribute exists.

      • getLocationOfChildUnits

        ISourceLocation getLocationOfChildUnits()
        Gets the source location of this tag's child units.
        Returns:
        A source location.

      • getFirstChildUnit

        IMXMLUnitData getFirstChildUnit()
        Gets the first child unit inside this tag.

        The child unit may be a tag or text. If there is no child unit, this method returns null.

        Returns:
        The first child unit inside this tag.

      • getFirstChild

        IMXMLTagData getFirstChild(boolean includeEmptyTags)
        Gets the first child open tag of this tag.

        "First child" means the first open (or maybe empty) tag found before a close tag. If this is a close tag, this method starts looking after the corresponding start tag.

        Returns:
        Child tag, or null if none.

      • getNextSibling

        IMXMLTagData getNextSibling(boolean includeEmptyTags)
        Gets the next sibling open tag of this tag.

        "Sibling" is defined as the first open (or maybe empty) tag after this tag's close tag. If this is a close tag, this method starts looking after the corresponding start tag.

        Returns:
        Sibling, or null if none.

      • findMatchingEndTag

        IMXMLTagData findMatchingEndTag()
        Finds the close tag that matches this tag.

        Returns null if this tag is a close or empty tag.

        Returns null if a surrounding tag is unbalanced; this is determined by backing up to the innermost parent tag with a different tag.

        <a> <b> <b> <-- find matching for this one will return null </b> </a> *

      • getCompilableText

        String getCompilableText()
        Gets this compilable text inside this tag. The compilable text may appear as multiple child text units, and there may also be comments (which are ignored). If any child units are tags rather than text, they are simply ignored.
        Returns:
        The compilable text inside this tag.

      • isImplicit

        boolean isImplicit()
        Determines whether this tag does not actually exist within the MXML document that is its source.
        Returns:
        true if this tag is implicit.
